name: coiled

arranged in a series of circles, one above or inside the other: a coiled spring He stepped over a coiled hose and went onto the grass. See
coil
More examplesFewer examplesElectric currents running through a coiled wire will produce a magnetic field.Each chromosome is one long, tightly coiled thread of DNA.She has a tattoo of a coiled snake on her arm.
